description.narrative: Additional implementation of rainwater harvesting systems

Along with environmental sanitation the program also aims at addressing issues on climate change. Besides this the RAIN programs aims at conducting multiple Use system (MUS) activities such as use of waste water, slurry of biogas for productive purposes.

BSP- Nepal already has experience working with Mirco financing Institution in the implementation of rainwater harvesting program in different district. This knowledge and outcome will be replicated in this project site also for the financial sustainability.

BSPN's objective is to bring substantial positive changes in the lives of Nepali people in the greatest need by: • Improving access to quantity and quality water supply (mostly rainwater) and sanitation infrastructures, ground water recharge, improving personal hygiene, and improving domestic/ environmental sanitation situation particularly focusing children, women, poor, marginalised, community in remote area.

Financial sustainability : BSP- Nepal already has experience working with Mirco financing Institution in the implementation of rainwater harvesting program in different district. This knowledge and outcome will be replicated in this project site also for the financial sustainability. This proposal is in line with the earlier proposal submitted for the same period 2012-2013. The proposal is developed for addressing the water, sanitation and hygiene issues of the rural areas of selected villages in Salyan - Korbang Jhimpe, Ghajaripipal and Kupindedaha. The focus is on enabling access to water for drinking, domestic use, operating biogas and micro irrigation.
The project has targeted its intervention to the poorest and most vulnerable people, households and communities which has difficult access for drinking water. The project assumes to improve quality of life of those villages and same time enhance entrepreneurship skill for sustainability of the FIETS approach.
